00039 // Some GUI_BUTTON system defines
00040 #define BUTTON_USE_DEFAULT          -1
00041 #define BUTTON_NO_FILENAME          NULL
00042 #define BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK          NULL
00043 #define BUTTON_NO_IMAGE                   -1
00044 #define BUTTON_NO_SLOT                    -1
00045 
00046 #define BUTTON_INIT                                   1
00047 #define BUTTON_WAS_CLICKED          2
00048 
00049 //effects how the button is rendered.
00050 #define BUTTON_TYPES                                  ( BUTTON_QUICK | BUTTON_GENERIC | BUTTON_HOT_SPOT | BUTTON_CHECKBOX )
00051 //effects how the button is processed
00052 #define BUTTON_TYPE_MASK                        (BUTTON_NO_TOGGLE| BUTTON_ALLOW_DISABLED_CALLBACK | BUTTON_CHECKBOX | BUTTON_IGNORE_CLICKS )
00053 
00054 //button flags
00055 #define BUTTON_TOGGLE                                                         0x00000000
00056 #define BUTTON_QUICK                                                          0x00000000
00057 #define BUTTON_ENABLED                                                  0x00000001
00058 #define BUTTON_CLICKED_ON                                               0x00000002
00059 #define BUTTON_NO_TOGGLE                                                0x00000004
00060 #define BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK                               0x00000008
00061 #define BUTTON_MOVE_CALLBACK                                0x00000010
00062 #define BUTTON_GENERIC                                                  0x00000020
00063 #define BUTTON_HOT_SPOT                                                 0x00000040
00064 #define BUTTON_SELFDELETE_IMAGE                             0x00000080
00065 #define BUTTON_DELETION_PENDING                             0x00000100
00066 #define BUTTON_ALLOW_DISABLED_CALLBACK    0x00000200
00067 #define BUTTON_DIRTY                                                          0x00000400
00068 #define BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND                               0x00000800
00069 #define BUTTON_CHECKBOX                                                 0x00001000
00070 #define BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE                                                0x00002000
00071 #define BUTTON_FORCE_UNDIRTY                                0x00004000 // no matter what happens this buttons does NOT get marked dirty
00072 #define BUTTON_IGNORE_CLICKS                                0x00008000 // Ignore any clicks on this button
00073 #define BUTTON_DISABLED_CALLBACK                      0x80000000
00074 
00075 #define BUTTON_SOUND_NONE                                                           0x00
00076 #define BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_ON                                         0x01
00077 #define BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_OFF                                  0x02
00078 #define BUTTON_SOUND_MOVED_ONTO                                         0x04
00079 #define BUTTON_SOUND_MOVED_OFF_OF                                 0x08
00080 #define BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_CLICK                         0x10
00081 #define BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_MOVED_ONTO        0x20
00082 #define BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_MOVED_OFF_OF      0x40
00083 #define BUTTON_SOUND_ALREADY_PLAYED                         0X80
00084 
00085 #define BUTTON_SOUND_ALL_EVENTS                                         0xff
00086

00088 // Internal use!
00089 #define     GUI_SND_CLK_ON                                                    BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_ON                               
00090 #define     GUI_SND_CLK_OFF                                                   BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_OFF                              
00091 #define     GUI_SND_MOV_ON                                                    BUTTON_SOUND_MOVED_ONTO                               
00092 #define     GUI_SND_MOV_OFF                                                   BUTTON_SOUND_MOVED_OFF_OF                             
00093 #define     GUI_SND_DCLK                                                            BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_CLICK                     
00094 #define     GUI_SND_DMOV                                                            BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_MOVED_ONTO

00096 extern UINT32 ButtonDestBuffer;
00097 
00098 // GUI_BUTTON callback function type
00099 typedef void (*GUI_CALLBACK)(struct _GUI_BUTTON *,INT32);
00100 
00101 // GUI_BUTTON structure definitions.
00102 typedef struct _GUI_BUTTON {
00103       INT32                         IDNum;                                    // ID Number, contains it's own button number
00104       UINT32                        ImageNum;                           // Image number to use (see DOCs for details)
00105       MOUSE_REGION      Area;                                     // Mouse System's mouse region to use for this button
00106       GUI_CALLBACK      ClickCallback;          // Button Callback when button is clicked
00107       GUI_CALLBACK      MoveCallback;                 // Button Callback when mouse moved on this region
00108       INT16                         Cursor;                                   // Cursor to use for this button
00109       UINT32                        uiFlags;                            // Button state flags etc.( 32-bit )
00110       UINT32                        uiOldFlags;                   // Old flags from previous render loop
00111       INT16                         XLoc;                                     // Coordinates where button is on the screen
00112       INT16                         YLoc;
00113       INT32                         UserData[4];                  // Place holder for user data etc.
00114       INT16                         Group;                                    // Group this button belongs to (see DOCs)
00115       INT8                          bDefaultStatus;
00116       //Button disabled style
00117       INT8                          bDisabledStyle;
00118       //For buttons with text
00119       UINT16                        *string;                            //the string
00120       UINT16                        usFont;                                   //font for text 
00121       BOOLEAN                       fMultiColor;                  //font is a multi-color font
00122       INT16                         sForeColor;                   //text colors if there is text
00123       INT16                         sShadowColor;                 
00124       INT16                         sForeColorDown;         //text colors when button is down (optional)
00125       INT16                         sShadowColorDown;
00126       INT16                         sForeColorHilited;            //text colors when button is down (optional)
00127       INT16                         sShadowColorHilited;
00128       INT8                          bJustification;         // BUTTON_TEXT_LEFT, BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER, BUTTON_TEXT_RIGHT
00129       INT8                          bTextXOffset;
00130       INT8                          bTextYOffset;
00131       INT8                          bTextXSubOffSet;
00132       INT8                          bTextYSubOffSet;
00133       BOOLEAN                       fShiftText;
00134       INT16                         sWrappedWidth;
00135       //For buttons with icons (don't confuse this with quickbuttons which have up to 5 states )
00136       INT32                         iIconID;                                        
00137       INT16                         usIconIndex;
00138       INT8                          bIconXOffset; //-1 means horizontally centered
00139       INT8                          bIconYOffset; //-1 means vertically centered
00140       BOOLEAN                       fShiftImage;  //if true, icon is shifted +1,+1 when button state is down.
00141 
00142       UINT8                         ubToggleButtonOldState;       // Varibles for new toggle buttons that work
00143       UINT8                         ubToggleButtonActivated;
00144 
00145       INT32                         BackRect;                           // Handle to a Background Rectangle
00146       UINT8                         ubSoundSchemeID;
00147 } GUI_BUTTON;
00148

00150 #define MAX_BUTTONS                             400
00151 
00152 extern GUI_BUTTON             *ButtonList[MAX_BUTTONS];                                                     // Button System's Main Button List
00153 
00154 #define GetButtonPtr(x) (((x>=0) && (x<MAX_BUTTONS))? ButtonList[x] : NULL)
00155 
00156 // Struct definition for the QuickButton pictures.
00157 typedef struct {
00158       HVOBJECT    vobj;                               // The Image itself
00159       INT32             Grayed;                             // Index to use for a "Grayed-out" button
00160       INT32             OffNormal;              // Index to use when button is OFF
00161       INT32             OffHilite;              // Index to use when button is OFF w/ hilite on it
00162       INT32             OnNormal;                     // Index to use when button is ON
00163       INT32             OnHilite;                     // Index to use when button is ON w/ hilite on it
00164       UINT32            MaxWidth;                     // Width of largest image in use
00165       UINT32            MaxHeight;              // Height of largest image in use
00166       UINT32            fFlags;                             // Special image flags
00167 } BUTTON_PICS;

00239 //Providing you have allocated your own image, this is a somewhat simplified function.
00240 INT32 QuickCreateButton(UINT32 Image, INT16 xloc, INT16 yloc, INT32 Type,INT16 Priority,GUI_CALLBACK MoveCallback,GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback);
00241 
00242 //A hybrid of QuickCreateButton.  Takes a lot less parameters, but makes more assumptions.  It self manages the 
00243 //loading, and deleting of the image.  The size of the image determines the size of the button.  It also uses
00244 //the default move callback which emulates Win95.  Finally, it sets the priority to normal.  The function you
00245 //choose also determines the type of button (toggle, notoggle, or newtoggle)
00246 template <typename string3>
00247 INT32 CreateEasyNoToggleButton ( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback );
00248 
00249 template <typename string3>
00250 INT32 CreateEasyToggleButton   ( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback );
00251 
00252 template <typename string3>
00253 INT32 CreateEasyNewToggleButton( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback );
00254 //Same as above, but accepts specify toggle type
00255

00257 INT32 CreateEasyButton( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, INT32 Type, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback);
00258 //Same as above, but accepts priority specification.
00259 template <typename string3>
00260 INT32 CreateSimpleButton( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, INT32 Type, INT16 Priority, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback );

00303       DEFAULT_STATUS_DARKBORDER,                //shades the borders 2 pixels deep

00310 enum //for use with SpecifyDisabledButtonStyle
00311 {
00312       DISABLED_STYLE_NONE,          //for dummy buttons, panels, etc.  Always displays normal state.
00313       DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT, //if button has text then shade, else hatch
00314       DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED, //always hatches the disabled button
00315       DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED         //always shades the disabled button 25% darker
00316 };
